studyArms.name: Ontamalimab 75 mg
studyArms.description: Participants receive ontamalimab 75 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks (Q4W) starting on Day 1, with the last dose administered at Week 20 (total treatment period is 24 weeks)

studyCohorts.name: Noncirrhotic (F1-F3)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with NASH and liver fibrosis stage F1, F2, or F3 (noncirrhotic)

studyCohorts.name: Compensated Cirrhotic (F4cc)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with NASH and liver fibrosis stage F4 compensated cirrhotic

arms.name: Ontamalimab 75 mg
arms.description: Participants receive ontamalimab 75 mg administered subcutaneously every 4 weeks (Q4W) starting on Day 1, with the last dose administered at Week 20 (total treatment period is 24 weeks)

cohorts.name: Noncirrhotic (F1-F3)
cohorts.characteristic: Participants with NASH and liver fibrosis stage F1, F2, or F3 (noncirrhotic)

cohorts.name: Compensated Cirrhotic (F4cc)
cohorts.characteristic: Participants with NASH and liver fibrosis stage F4 compensated cirrhotic

epochs.name: Screening
epochs.description: Up to 10 weeks (may be extended up to 12 weeks for SARS-CoV-2 positive participants, or up to 24 weeks for F4cc participants pending safety data)

epochs.name: Treatment
epochs.description: 24 weeks (ontamalimab administered Q4W from Day 1 through Week 20)

epochs.name: Follow-up
epochs.description: 12 weeks after last dose of study drug
